linefit.IO

Class LineFitFileIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • linefit.IO.LineFitFileIO

  • public class LineFitFileIO
extends java.lang.Object
    This class Handles reading and saving LineFit data files so that the rest of the code does not need to know the precise format of the data file. Each class that has data to save must provide functionality for retrieving and setting the data.
    Since:
    0.99.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Keith Rice

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private javax.swing.JFileChooser fileChooser
      The JFileChooser that allows the user to select files to open or import with a GUI

      The GeneralIO instance that this LineFitFileIO is linked to that is used to perform the more standard IO operations
      private int lastSelectedFileDialogChoice
      the returned value from the dialog box that allows the user to select a file to open or import
      private LineFit lineFit
      The LineFit instance that this LineFitFileIO is linked to
      private static java.lang.String saveFileExtension
      The file extension to use for the saved LineFit files

    • Constructor Detail

      • LineFitFileIO

        public LineFitFileIO(GeneralIO parentIO,
                     LineFit lineFitToAssociateWith)
        The constructor for LineFitFileIO that uses the passed GeneralIO for common functionality and saves data for the passed LineFit instance
        Parameters:
        parentIO - The GeneralIO instance that this LineFitFileIO belongs to and uses for common IO related functionality
        lineFitToAssociateWith - The LineFit instance that this handles the file IO for

    • Method Detail

      • chooseLineFitFile

        public java.io.File chooseLineFitFile()
        Opens a dialog in the most recent directory and prompts the user for LineFit file to open.
        Returns:
        The file that was selected or null if the selection was aborted

      • chooseAndOpenLineFitFile

        public void chooseAndOpenLineFitFile(boolean offerChoiceToNotReadInGraphSettings)
        Opens up a LineFit file in this instance of LineFit after allowing the user to choose which file to open
        Parameters:
        offerChoiceToNotReadInGraphSettings - Whether or not the user can choose not to import the graph settings. This should only be false when opening a file on start up

      • openLineFitFile

        public void openLineFitFile(java.lang.String filePath,
                            boolean offerChoiceToNotReadInGraphSettings)
        Opens the lineFit file at the specified path
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path to open the file up at
        offerChoiceToNotReadInGraphSettings - Whether or not the user can choose not to import the graph settings. This should only be false when opening a file on start up

      • openLineFitFile

        public void openLineFitFile(java.io.File fileToOpen,
                            boolean offerChoiceToNotReadInGraphSettings)
        Opens the given LineFit file and prompts the user if they want to read in the graph settings if the flag is set to
        Parameters:
        fileToOpen - The file to open containing the LineFit graph data
        offerChoiceToNotReadInGraphSettings - Whether of not the user is prompted id they want to read in the graph settings as well as the datasets. True means that the user is prompted

      • readAndCheckFileVersion

        private void readAndCheckFileVersion(java.io.BufferedReader inputReader)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Attempts to read in the LineFit file version number and resets the position if it was not found (i.e. its the original file format). If finds the version line then it will check the version in the file to see if this LineFit knows how to read in that version and will warn the user if it is an unsupported version.
        Parameters:
        inputReader - The BufferefReader for the LineFit file being read in
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the BufferedReader encounters and error

      • saveLineFitFile

        public void saveLineFitFile()
        Prompts the user for where to save the LineFit file and saves the data in the LineFit instance this is linked to to the selected file

      • outputDataToFile

        private void outputDataToFile(java.util.Formatter output)
        Retrieves the information in the LineFit file and writes it to the passed formatter in the correct LineFit file format
        Parameters:
        output - the Formatter for the file being saved to write the LineFit file data to
